author: Gosaka

text: Now this is a series I really need to play, I've never played a single game from it. I'll start with the first one on the SNES, which seems excellent. This track is from the PS1 version and is quite emotional, Matsueda did a great job. It's the first game she composed for; it's a shame she only worked on a few games before retiring as a VGM composer.
author: SupraDarky

text: @***** +1 on everything you said! I liked FM1, but FM3 takes the cake for me. FM4 was also pretty good, but just not as good of a story as 3. And Front Mission Evolved was just a watered down version of Armored Core, in every aspect.
author: allthatishere

text: Don't forget to play Gun Hazard.  Gameplay deviates drastically from the rest of the series, but story and, of course, soundtrack are both top notch.
author: Hiryuu Honyaku

text: You always talk about games you've never played, that you need to play... and I know exactly how you feel. Growing up, I had all the time in the world to play all these really amazing games but because I was just a kid, I had no money to buy them. Now I have the money to afford all these games I wanted to play as a kid, but I don't have the time.
author: Gorilla Games

text: +GamesquadSquad Time is money and most people can only have so much of both.

text: The plot of FM1 is really good and relevant to our future I think.
